questions.question: The number of amplified pieces of DNA equals -------- after five cycles of PCR
Is it possible to use PCR to produce many copies of all DNA of one chromosome ?

answers.a: yes, if the correct primers are available
answers.c: No, PCR cannot copy DNA, only RNA
answers.d: No, PCR copies short pieces of DNA only.

questions.question: PCR requires knowledge about parts of a target DNA sequence to be amplified. True or False?
Which of the following is an advantage of single - primer PCR?

answers.a: Less synthetic DNA is incorporated into the product
answers.b: Unknown sequence adjacent to a known sequence can be amplified with a single primer
